title.narrative: Innovations in Solar Power and Hybrid Technologies

description.narrative: The key objective is to support the GOI promote large-scale deployment of innovative technologies in the RE sector, including solar-wind hybrid systems, integrated energy storage for solar and wind, and floating solar PV panels as follows: o Large-scale solar-wind hybrid power plant(s), potentially with short-term energy storage, with a cumulative capacity of about 230 MW. Such subprojects are expected to improve power generated per unit piece of land while reducing the variability of the generation from standalone RE plants. o Stand-alone plants for solar PV with storage, with a cumulative capacity of 50 MW. Since such technology is not yet commercially viable, the project will demonstrate the benefits expected out of storage solutions and hence a step towards opening up the market for private sector investments. o Large-scale floating solar PV power plants with a cumulative capacity of about 20 MW.
